newsitem.title: UK: TNT wide-body plane purchase likely in 98.
newsitem.headline: TNT wide-body plane purchase likely in 98.

text.p: TNT is likely to "trade-up" up to its first wide-body jets next year as part of its move to a new purpose built European hub at Liege early next year, a TNT spokesman said.

But before a final decision is taken the express carrier, which is now owned by Dutch telecommunications and postal group Koninklijke PTT Nederland NV, is completing a strategic review of its likely requirements.
TNT's European fleet comprises some 31 aircraft including 17 BAe 146-200QTs, six Boeing 727-200F and five smaller planes including two Metros.
TNT has shortlisted conversions of the Airbus A300, which can carry of 30 tonnes in cargo configuration, and the 28-29 tonne capacity Boeing 757F.
Subject to availability in the second-hand market, TNT hopes to have three wide-body planes in service by 1999.
The entire 727 fleet should be replaced by 2002.

TNT does not hold an operating licence and its planes are operated by Air Foyle, Eurowings, Hunting, Mistral and Sterling European, the spokesman said. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
